abstract.text: A metadata item for an audiovisual asset or one of its tracks.

inlineContent.text: organizes metadata. To simplify finding and filtering metadata items, the framework groups related metadata into key spaces:

The framework defines several format-specific key spaces. They roughly correlate to a particular container or file format, such as QuickTime (QuickTime metadata and user data) or MP3 (ID3). However, a single asset may contain metadata values across multiple key spaces. To retrieve an asset’s complete collection of format-specific metadata, you use its

There are several common metadata values, such as a movie’s creation date or description, that can exist across multiple key spaces. To help normalize access to this common metadata, the framework provides a common key space that gives access to a limited set of metadata values common to several key spaces. This makes it easy to retrieve commonly used metadata without concern for the specific format. To retrieve an asset’s collection of common metadata, you use its

Metadata items have keys that accord with the specification of the container format from which they’re drawn. Full details of the metadata formats, metadata keys, and metadata key spaces supported by AVFoundation are available in
To load values of a metadata item when you access them for the first time, use the methods from the
class and other classes in turn provide their metadata as needed so that you can obtain objects from those arrays without incurring overhead for items you don’t inspect.
To filter arrays of metadata items, you use the methods of this class. For example, you can filter by key and key space, by locale, and by preferred language.

abstract.text: Work with audiovisual assets, control device cameras, process audio, and configure system audio interactions.
An object that models timed audiovisual media.
The metadata items an asset contains for common metadata identifiers that provide a value.
An array of metadata items for all metadata identifiers for which a value is available.
A protocol that defines the interface to load media data asynchronously.
A structure that defines keys for extra metadata attributes.
A structure that defines metadata formats.
A structure that defines identifiers for metadata formats.

An identifier for a metadata item.
Returns a metadata identifier for the specified key and key space.
Creates a metadata item whose value loads on an on-demand basis only.
The key of the metadata item.

The key space for the metadata item’s key.
Returns a metadata key space for the specified identifier.
Tells the object to load the values of any of the specified keys that aren’t already loaded.
The locale of the metadata item.
Returns metadata items whose locales match one of the specified language identifiers.
Returns filtered metadata items.
Returns metadata items for the specified identifier.
Returns metadata items that match a specified locale.
Returns metadata items that match a specified key or key space.
The value of the metadata item as a number.
The start date of the timed metadata.
Reports whether the value for a given key is immediately available without blocking.
The value of the metadata item as a string.
The timestamp of the metadata item.
The value of the metadata item.

An object that responds to a request to load the value of a metadata item.
A structure that defines a metadata key.
A structure that defines a metadata key space.

Build responsive apps by using language-level concurrency features to efficiently load media data.
Add chapter markers to enable users to quickly navigate your content.
Load descriptive metadata for media assets and their tracks.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
A protocol that mutable objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
